poem:
### Rally in the Streets

In the clatter and clang  
of boots on cobblestones,  
a discordant anthem rises.  
Voices, fierce and cold,  
erasing the sun  
with shadows—  
a fearsome choir.  
Yet, beneath the cacophony,  
quiet hands  
boldly weave unity,  
Threads of a flag  
untorn,   
but trembling.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. But Saturday’s rally, facing up to Tommy Robinson’s 110,000-strong “unite the kingdom” march in London, was the only one where I actually felt threatened. I was on the anti-racist counter march and we were outnumbered 20 to". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
